summary:
I’ve been called perfect
One too many times
I never believed it for one second
Too many eyes on me
But when you showed up
With...
body:
I’ve been called perfect

One too many times

I never believed it for one second

Too many eyes on me

But when you showed up

With your brilliant fire

It was the first time

I wanted to be perfect for real

The first time

I wanted someone to look at me

summary:
Yeet back at it again with the hot boys in red lifeguard outfits 
I have a Shinso coming up after this so stay tuned 
-
You...
body:
One Angry Lifeguard

Yeet back at it again with the hot boys in red lifeguard outfits

I have a Shinso coming up after this so stay tuned

-

You always loved the beach. If it was the roaring sea in your ears or the laughter of children that played in the distance you loved it all. However you would be guilty if you said you just loved the scenery. In fact there’s was another reason why you went to the beach so often but you would never tell anyone.

It was for your favorite raging lifeguard.

You always had a large small soft spot for him and seeing him in just his red swim trunks and shirtless body you couldn’t help yourself but stare at him. Of course the raging lifeguard caught wind of your staring weeks ago; right when summer break started actually and he simply return your stupid flirty gazes with showing off his abs in the sun and simply throwing his arms over his head to “stretch” but flex his muscles.

He loved watching you drool and peek up from your sunglasses knowing that all your attention was in him. What could he say? You boosted his ego and he loved the attention.

However as the days go on and you coming to visit him on weekends like a regular he noticed some other regulars that started to show up. Other regulars like…..them.

Those hotshot surfers at the beach. They always seemed to attract a crowed and Bakugo could care less about them but he noticed one of them trying to steal your gaze away from him.

Now that pissed him off. Like hell he’ll let some water brain idiot sweep you off your feet infront of him. He already set his eyes on you and he was damned ready to fight over you if he had to. However, no matter how much he wanted to walk over and just claim you there something in the back of him mind was holding him back.

The man was a prideful asshole and he knew that but it wasn’t pride that was keeping him back….it was fear of rejection. Bakugo was scared of approaching you even thought he never talked to you. He didn’t know if you liked his firey attitude or his blunt comments. Perhaps you were just looking at him for his looks.

“Yo Bakugo time to roatate!!!” A familiar voice called him and Bakugo looked over through his sunglasses and let out a huff.

His next rotation, the one closest to you. Infact you made yourself comfortable to sit right next to his post. Now if that didn’t sent a shiver through his spin then he might aswell said today was a cold day.

Of course Kirishima knew what was going on. Bakugo always packed up slowly so he looked like he dreaded going over (which was a lie). In fact Kirishima knew from the start about his crush on you and he’s been trying to encourage him to finally ask you out. And buy encourage his ment by talking about his girlfriend all the time and telling the raging blonde how he needed to find his special someone.

“Don’t fuck shit up shitty hair.” Bakugo said and Kirishima smiled with a toothy grin

“As to you Bakugo~” Kirishima smirked and patted Bakugo’s shoulder and sended him off.

Walking over to you Bakugo saw you move your legs and he stopped staring at your beautiful skin in the sun. What he wouldn’t give to have those to kiss and love—he shook his head. Damn him he really needed to get laid or something and having you here wasn’t helping his situation. When was the last time he was with another girl?

Making his way over across the many beach towels and umbrellas he caught a glance at your eyes again. You smiled at him and waved and Bakugo felt his face blush in full bloom making him miss his step and trip into a hole made by some teens.

The blonde hair groaned as he saw the teen looked down and Bakugo opened his eyes showing his rage. Quickly sitting up he climbed out of the hole and glared down the kids.

“You think it’s fuckin funny watching people trip in your traps you brats?!?” He asked and he saw the teen flinch

If anyone knew about this beach long enough it was don’t piss off the Lifeguards. Especially Bakugo the famous blonde for having a temper with rowdy teens.

“Well do ya!?!?!” Bakugo yelled and the teens looked down and they started stammering ouy excuses, all to which the blonde didn’t care. Bakugo sighed with a tsk and Pointed to all of them.

“Clean this fucking mess right now before I shove you all into the sand, go it!?!” He yelled and the teens nodded their head quickly making their way to fix up their mess.

Bakugo sighed and finally made his way to his post setting down his lifeguard tube and taking another drink of his water before climbing up to sit in his chair.

He heard you snicker from his left and he glanced down at you and he saw you watching the teens still clean in their mess. Bakugo growled again and watch them closely and watching the water for any weak swimmers.

“My~ You do live up to your locals descriptions.” You said and Bakugo looked down at you

“Hah?” He said and narrowed his eyes making you let out a laugh. If it was anyone laughing at him he would be sure to send them into next week with tons of marks but hearing you laugh made his face burn and he grumbled out some curse words and looked away. He had a job to do after all.

You sighed and looked over “You know you’re quite the funny guy.” You said and Bakugo rolled his eyes

“If you want a funny guy then go talk to dunce face.” He snapped and he could hear you tsk and to took off your sunglasses

“Alright I’ll cut the bullshit because I like ya,” you said and Bakugo snorts before he was grabbed buy his lanyard that had his whistle and pulled down to look at you. Bakugo gulped and you huffed, “I see you looking at me when I sunbathe I know you like me and frankly I like you too so let’s make this less than a hassle and go for a date yeah?” You said and let go.

Bakugo shook his head and blushed before he heard a scream and he looked over and sure enough some idiot teens were doing some crazy shit.

“Hey you fucks better stop that right now!!!!!!!” He yelled and stomped over while you watched and laughed.

Such a hot head you thought and you went to go back to your seat but a whistle caught your attention and you saw Bakugo storm up to you and in one dip of your body he kissed you hard.

You were too shocked to kiss him back but he didn’t need to know form that, if you wanted him he had eyes on you from the beginning. Pulling back he smirked and let out a sigh

“You better be fucking here after my shift.” He said and you smiled back and kissed his lip before putting on your sunglasses

“Sounds like a plan I’m assuming you’re taking me out.” You asked and Bakugo smirked

“Yeah let’s say something like that, I like to go big or go home~” he purred and you felt your face blush before he sat up and he heard his name being called

“See ya tonight babygirl can’t wait to see those tan lines~” he finally and walked off

That’s it you finally done it youhave created a sexy monster and it might kill you by the end of the night.

“Well do ya!?!?!” Bakugo yelled and the teens looked down and they started stammering ouy excuses, all to which the blonde didn’t care. Bakugo sighed with a tsk and Pointed to all of them.

“Clean this fucking mess right now before I shove you all into the sand, go it!?!” He yelled and the teens nodded their head quickly making their way to fix up their mess.

Bakugo sighed and finally made his way to his post setting down his lifeguard tube and taking another drink of his water before climbing up to sit in his chair.

He heard you snicker from his left and he glanced down at you and he saw you watching the teens still clean in their mess. Bakugo growled again and watch them closely and watching the water for any weak swimmers.

“My~ You do live up to your locals descriptions.” You said and Bakugo looked down at you

“Hah?” He said and narrowed his eyes making you let out a laugh. If it was anyone laughing at him he would be sure to send them into next week with tons of marks but hearing you laugh made his face burn and he grumbled out some curse words and looked away. He had a job to do after all.

You sighed and looked over “You know you’re quite the funny guy.” You said and Bakugo rolled his eyes

“If you want a funny guy then go talk to dunce face.” He snapped and he could hear you tsk and to took off your sunglasses

“Alright I’ll cut the bullshit because I like ya,” you said and Bakugo snorts before he was grabbed buy his lanyard that had his whistle and pulled down to look at you. Bakugo gulped and you huffed, “I see you looking at me when I sunbathe I know you like me and frankly I like you too so let’s make this less than a hassle and go for a date yeah?” You said and let go.

Bakugo shook his head and blushed before he heard a scream and he looked over and sure enough some idiot teens were doing some crazy shit.

“Hey you fucks better stop that right now!!!!!!!” He yelled and stomped over while you watched and laughed.

Such a hot head you thought and you went to go back to your seat but a whistle caught your attention and you saw Bakugo storm up to you and in one dip of your body he kissed you hard.

You were too shocked to kiss him back but he didn’t need to know form that, if you wanted him he had eyes on you from the beginning. Pulling back he smirked and let out a sigh

“You better be fucking here after my shift.” He said and you smiled back and kissed his lip before putting on your sunglasses

“Sounds like a plan I’m assuming you’re taking me out.” You asked and Bakugo smirked

“Yeah let’s say something like that, I like to go big or go home~” he purred and you felt your face blush before he sat up and he heard his name being called

“See ya tonight babygirl can’t wait to see those tan lines~” he finally and walked off

That’s it you finally done it youhave created a sexy monster and it might kill you by the end of the night.

body:
Lavender (TodoBaku)


AO3: https://archiveofourown.org/works/19178758

Fandom: Boku no Hero Academia
Summary: Based on “norway.today”.Katsuki and Shouto go out to end it all because nothing really matters.
Warnings: Discussion of Death and Suicide, brief (very brief) mentions of sex

“I want to die.”
“Me too.”

Katsuki watches the mountains outside of the car while shoving endless amounts of Pocky sticks in his mouth. Though he has seen mountains before, these are even more amazing. Bigger, higher, even more dangerous. He looks up to them. Sometimes he wishes he were a mountain. Nobody could move them. Everyone was impressed by them. Everyone respected them. And anyone who dared to not respect a mountain died. Katsuki likes the thought.
The sun is already setting and just the peeks of the mountains, covered in snow are still glittering in golden sunlight. Everything else slowly fades into blue. Deep blue shadows of mountains that swallow everything. Katsuki likes the thought.

“Would someone miss you?”
“What does it matter?”

Shouto had been listening to Katsuki’s crunches for two hours now. He won’t dare to look outside. He doesn’t want to see this. He doesn’t need to. He will have forgotten in a few hours anyway. It had become too dark to read in the car an hour ago. Now he just stares at his hands and waits.
Either to wake up in a few moments, realize he had been dreaming and start an average day of life with a pretty average breakfast and some average, meaningless conversation with lame people.
Or until they reach their destination, get out the taxi and get this all over with.
So he waits.

“What if we fail?”
“It’s all or nothing. No pity-attempts.”

They set up their tent ten meters away from the edge. It’s dark and they hardly see anything at all. It’s cold and Shouto wears a tank top. As they slip inside the tent and under their covers he still shivers. Katsuki shuffles closer to him and slips under his blanket too. “Why didn’t you bring warmer clothes?” – “I thought it wouldn’t matter.” Katsuki tries to come closer and hugs him. Shouto doesn’t say anything. He just hugs back. The warmth is nice. He wonders what it feels like to hug a dead person. Katsuki puts his hands on Shouto’s back and starts rubbing it slowly. With time, he gets more confident and rubs Shoutos neck and his hips and his torso. Shouto doesn’t say anything. “What if I fucked you right now?” Katsuki asked. Shrug. “You wouldn’t care?” – “I’ll forget it anyway.” – “You’ll forget I fucked you?” – “I will forget everything.” Silence.
“So… If we were naked right now…” He tries to create a mental image of naked Shouto. “And I’d be running my fingers down the inside of your thighs…” – “I’d tell you to stop fooling around and just do it.” Katsuki hesitates. “And I think I’d be pretty nervous.” Shouto shifts a little to look him in the eyes. They can barely make out each other’s faces. “You? You would be nervous?” He nods. “I wouldn’t be. I’d think it’d be over in a few minutes and we won’t even know it happened at all within the next few hours. There’s no evidence of anything. I could let go. I wouldn’t care.” With that, Shouto turns around.

“You’re an idiot. You’re gonna die because nothing matters. And nothing matters because you’re gonna die.” Shuffling closer to Shouto’s back, Katsuki slams his fist against his back. “You’re so unromantic. There is just nothing that matters to you.”
Silence.
“That is the point. That is why I am here. Why I texted you in the first place. Nothing matters. Nothing ever will. We’re all going to die, so we might as well get it over with now.” Katsuki breathes heavily. “Fuck.” He gets up and grabs Shouto’s shoulders shaking him. “I want to live before I die. How else do I know I’m dead!?”

“Will you hold my hand?”
“Okay.”

Shouto wakes up when Katsuki starts snoring beside him. The tent is bathed in blue light and as Shouto sticks his head out. The sun is slowly rising behind the tip of the far mountains. His stomach makes weird sound and his mouth feels dry. He thinks about going to the edge and looking down. He doesn’t know what’s down there. Maybe it’s stone and he’ll crash down and his body will explode like a disgusting grenade and leave blood everywhere. Or it’s trees and a branch will catch his body and part him in two pieces. Or it’s water and he’ll just sink down to the ground in an awkward misshaped form. Shouto doesn’t really know what he’d prefer. He takes on a shirt and slips out of the tent.

“How?”
“Jump with me.”

When Katsuki wakes up, it’s because the sun heats up the tent and he almost chokes. Shouto isn’t there anymore and he wonders if Shouto is even still here with him. When he steps outside, he’s sitting on the ground staring at his book. “Hi”, Katsuki says and it sounds scratchy and forced. “Hi.” Shouto puts down his book and looks at him as he pulls a water bottle from the tent and drinks. The stare makes him uncomfortable after a few seconds so he holds the bottle in Shouto’s direction. “Water?” Shouto finishes the bottle.
Katsuki sits down beside him. “Did you look down?” – “No.” – “Coward.” Silence.
“Would you look down with me?”
“Huh?” Katsuki turns his head. Shouto looks back.
“…Okay”, he says slowly. After little hesitation, he takes Shouto’s hand. They get up and walk towards the edge.

“What if I pushed you down?”, Katsuki asks. “I don’t care.” They take the last step, look at each other, look down.
It’s water.
“How high is this?”, Shouto asks. “I dunno, like 50 meters?”, Katsuki throws a pebble down. “Have you been here?” – “Nah, just in a village nearby. Never actually seen the cliff.” They look down for a few minutes. “What happens when you fall? Like, when you know you’re gonna be dead? Does your life flash before you? Or does…” – “How should I know?” Shouto takes off his shoes. “Let’s find out.” Katsuki’s eyes widen. “Wait, wait… now?” They look at each other. “Yeah, now.” Throwing his shoes towards the tent, Shouto closes his eyes and takes a deep breath. “Wait, wait!” Katsuki grabs his wrist. “We should…”, he throws his head around searching for something.

Shouto opens his eyes and turns around. Katsuki looks at him, his hand still holding tightly onto his wrist. “I don’t wanna die.”

“I sometimes wish I’d never been born at all.”
“Love me.”

“I sometimes wish I’d never been born at all.”
“Love me.”
trail.content:
Lavender (TodoBaku)


AO3: https://archiveofourown.org/works/19178758

Fandom: Boku no Hero Academia
Summary: Based on “norway.today”.Katsuki and Shouto go out to end it all because nothing really matters.
Warnings: Discussion of Death and Suicide, brief (very brief) mentions of sex

“I want to die.”
“Me too.”

Katsuki watches the mountains outside of the car while shoving endless amounts of Pocky sticks in his mouth. Though he has seen mountains before, these are even more amazing. Bigger, higher, even more dangerous. He looks up to them. Sometimes he wishes he were a mountain. Nobody could move them. Everyone was impressed by them. Everyone respected them. And anyone who dared to not respect a mountain died. Katsuki likes the thought.
The sun is already setting and just the peeks of the mountains, covered in snow are still glittering in golden sunlight. Everything else slowly fades into blue. Deep blue shadows of mountains that swallow everything. Katsuki likes the thought.

“Would someone miss you?”
“What does it matter?”

Shouto had been listening to Katsuki’s crunches for two hours now. He won’t dare to look outside. He doesn’t want to see this. He doesn’t need to. He will have forgotten in a few hours anyway. It had become too dark to read in the car an hour ago. Now he just stares at his hands and waits.
Either to wake up in a few moments, realize he had been dreaming and start an average day of life with a pretty average breakfast and some average, meaningless conversation with lame people.
Or until they reach their destination, get out the taxi and get this all over with.
So he waits.

“What if we fail?”
“It’s all or nothing. No pity-attempts.”

They set up their tent ten meters away from the edge. It’s dark and they hardly see anything at all. It’s cold and Shouto wears a tank top. As they slip inside the tent and under their covers he still shivers. Katsuki shuffles closer to him and slips under his blanket too. “Why didn’t you bring warmer clothes?” – “I thought it wouldn’t matter.” Katsuki tries to come closer and hugs him. Shouto doesn’t say anything. He just hugs back. The warmth is nice. He wonders what it feels like to hug a dead person. Katsuki puts his hands on Shouto’s back and starts rubbing it slowly. With time, he gets more confident and rubs Shoutos neck and his hips and his torso. Shouto doesn’t say anything. “What if I fucked you right now?” Katsuki asked. Shrug. “You wouldn’t care?” – “I’ll forget it anyway.” – “You’ll forget I fucked you?” – “I will forget everything.” Silence.
“So… If we were naked right now…” He tries to create a mental image of naked Shouto. “And I’d be running my fingers down the inside of your thighs…” – “I’d tell you to stop fooling around and just do it.” Katsuki hesitates. “And I think I’d be pretty nervous.” Shouto shifts a little to look him in the eyes. They can barely make out each other’s faces. “You? You would be nervous?” He nods. “I wouldn’t be. I’d think it’d be over in a few minutes and we won’t even know it happened at all within the next few hours. There’s no evidence of anything. I could let go. I wouldn’t care.” With that, Shouto turns around.

“You’re an idiot. You’re gonna die because nothing matters. And nothing matters because you’re gonna die.” Shuffling closer to Shouto’s back, Katsuki slams his fist against his back. “You’re so unromantic. There is just nothing that matters to you.”
Silence.
“That is the point. That is why I am here. Why I texted you in the first place. Nothing matters. Nothing ever will. We’re all going to die, so we might as well get it over with now.” Katsuki breathes heavily. “Fuck.” He gets up and grabs Shouto’s shoulders shaking him. “I want to live before I die. How else do I know I’m dead!?”

“Will you hold my hand?”
“Okay.”

Shouto wakes up when Katsuki starts snoring beside him. The tent is bathed in blue light and as Shouto sticks his head out. The sun is slowly rising behind the tip of the far mountains. His stomach makes weird sound and his mouth feels dry. He thinks about going to the edge and looking down. He doesn’t know what’s down there. Maybe it’s stone and he’ll crash down and his body will explode like a disgusting grenade and leave blood everywhere. Or it’s trees and a branch will catch his body and part him in two pieces. Or it’s water and he’ll just sink down to the ground in an awkward misshaped form. Shouto doesn’t really know what he’d prefer. He takes on a shirt and slips out of the tent.

“How?”
“Jump with me.”

When Katsuki wakes up, it’s because the sun heats up the tent and he almost chokes. Shouto isn’t there anymore and he wonders if Shouto is even still here with him. When he steps outside, he’s sitting on the ground staring at his book. “Hi”, Katsuki says and it sounds scratchy and forced. “Hi.” Shouto puts down his book and looks at him as he pulls a water bottle from the tent and drinks. The stare makes him uncomfortable after a few seconds so he holds the bottle in Shouto’s direction. “Water?” Shouto finishes the bottle.
Katsuki sits down beside him. “Did you look down?” – “No.” – “Coward.” Silence.
“Would you look down with me?”
“Huh?” Katsuki turns his head. Shouto looks back.
“…Okay”, he says slowly. After little hesitation, he takes Shouto’s hand. They get up and walk towards the edge.

“What if I pushed you down?”, Katsuki asks. “I don’t care.” They take the last step, look at each other, look down.
It’s water.
“How high is this?”, Shouto asks. “I dunno, like 50 meters?”, Katsuki throws a pebble down. “Have you been here?” – “Nah, just in a village nearby. Never actually seen the cliff.” They look down for a few minutes. “What happens when you fall? Like, when you know you’re gonna be dead? Does your life flash before you? Or does…” – “How should I know?” Shouto takes off his shoes. “Let’s find out.” Katsuki’s eyes widen. “Wait, wait… now?” They look at each other. “Yeah, now.” Throwing his shoes towards the tent, Shouto closes his eyes and takes a deep breath. “Wait, wait!” Katsuki grabs his wrist. “We should…”, he throws his head around searching for something.

Shouto opens his eyes and turns around. Katsuki looks at him, his hand still holding tightly onto his wrist. “I don’t wanna die.”

“I sometimes wish I’d never been born at all.”
“Love me.”

summary: Would anyone be interested if I made a ghost tododeku AU comic?
body:
Would anyone be interested if I made a ghost tododeku AU comic?

I was browsing the ‘imagine your OTP’ tag and got an idea. It would concentrate on tododeku but I would try to make the story as complete as possible including the most characters, the villains, the teachers ect… pls give me your feedback. I’ll put the first chapter in link as soon as it’s made :)
